> OOC - Assuming ths pose is set 'before' the time skip and other events.

OOC: Oh yes, before the time jump. At some point Elder will be called
away, but right now he is still free.


> <OLD>
>
> Glancing up at the LORD ELDER, Wheelie glanced up at him from his position
> over nearby the ARK.
>
> Finally, WHEELIE spoke, "They went out looking for a fight.  They did not
> intend to go gentle into that good night.  While everyone is about and away,
> someone else may come to play.  The Ark is what's here in the past, someone
> else may consider it to be excessive ballast.  Something is up, what I don't
> know, I just know I see Maximals about on the go.  I don't know why they're
> running around, nor what they intend to do on the ground."
>
> Watching as the assault team zipped away, "Something may happen to call them
> back, or they may encounter a bit of flak.  What they intend, I don't know.
> I just know you don't put your all into one big throw.  You sometimes want
> to hold some back, just in case you get a smack.  If they go into a trap, be
> lured away for an attack.  At the Ark some of us must stay.  Especially
> while everyone else is away."
>
> Continuing to glance around, "This planet is not as it will be, etched into
> my memory.  It will be different some day.  I don't belong here any way.
> But what way iwll it go?  That is what I do not know.  Will I still someday
> meet my friend?  Even though he will die in the end?  I do not know what
> will be our fate.  I can only simply commisserate."

<NEW>

LORD ELDER sat down next to wheelie and looked in the same direction
that WHEELIE had been looking until he came and interupted. "The
stars." he said as if in thought. "They come and they go and yet there
is little we can do but chart their course and watch them as they
move."

He smiled, "Not so with Maximals and even Predacons. So many things
change us, move us. Things that at one time seemed immutable are
things of the past." He looked back at the stars, "But one day this
planet will change, and the stars above it will change and hopefully
what we do now won't change that."

There was a nod from ELDER, "But yes, some of us must stay behind to
guard the Ark. in a way it is that last bastion against change."

There was a thoughtful look, "But earlier you seemed so upset." ELDER
was of course talking about the meeting that WHEELIE had a part in
disturbing. "Your wit seemed unusually sharp. Is there something else
on your mind?"

(TAG)

Preston
